posts.content: With the value of these buses increasing daily, by this time tomorrow this bus could be worth 22 quid......or 1 million dollars! Bargain!

dawerks wrote:
1960 15 Window Deluxe. Bullet nose, high hinge. Original paint, never welded or repainted. All original except for wheels and middle seat (correct year included). Impossible to find in this condition for this price in this day. Needs full mechanical restoration. Price; 21 Gbp.

A word on pricing; check the classifieds (not just here, but worldwide) and I'm confident this is the best, most original condition bullet 15 Window at the best possible price. The value of this bus is increasing daily and you are paying last year's price in an exploding bus market.
21 Gbp ???? that has got to be the cheapest bus around.
I'll buy it, again, but please don't change your mind about selling this time

I'd never normally write anything here... But potential buyers just be cautious here!
I had a deal with JP with a 2 bus deal. A price was agreed, It was a lot of money for me! I had sent a deposit to JP, and in the meantime I had to sell a car to raise the rest of the money! To get the cash quick I sold the car cheaper... Then he pulls out of the deal. I lost money, I trusted him through emails he had set my mind at rest as I had read all his feedback on thesamba which is shocking, should have trusted everyone else who had dealt with him previous!
Please be very cautious with him
Matt

Vwejit wrote:With the value of these buses increasing daily, by this time tomorrow this bus could be worth 22 quid......or 1 million dollars! Bargain!
The price went up! From a mere 21 quid to 21,000! You were right about the increasing prices! Man these buses are a mint!

Also from my point of view, I had 2 or three people emailing about my bus. But as it turns out it was the same person simply grinding me on the price from 2-3 different accounts. Once I figured this out, I pulled out of the deal with Matt. And strangely enough, they all stopped emailing me at once!

What coincidence!

author.location: Mayrhofen, Austria (but my for sale bits are in the UK)

posts.content: oooh, some naughty claims right there !
3 sides to every story! Bottom line, my bus, and I didn't feel like selling it under duress and I backed out of the deal with full money returned.

A deal is a deal, if you took a deposit surely you should stick to your word .
Sounds like Matt went out of his way to secure this

No worries fellas, I will remove the ad if it's causing too much drama.

The deal with Matt was done under duress and I didn't want to do it. I accepted the deposit, went to sleep and woke up and refunded the deposit.
